p: M. didyma EO, isolated by steam distillation, comprised mainly monoterpenes, which represented approximately 98% of the total, and some sesquiterpenes (1.24%). M. didyma EO contained a high level of carvacrol (49.03%). The other main compounds were γ-terpinene (16.90%), p-cymene (7.60%), thymol (6.17%), carvacrol methyl ether (4.18%), 1-octen-3-ol (3.07%), α-terpinene (2.79%), myrcene (2.33%), α-thujene (1.39%), and limonene (1.03%) ( Table 1). In total, 23 compounds were identified; all compounds had already been described in the scientific literature [ 28].
